name: Telstar Classic - Model #6045
language: 1 - Tennis (2 players)2 - Hockey (2 players)3 - Handball (1 player)
description:
After the release of the Telstar (the first "dedicated-chip" pong system) in 1976 which was a big success, Coleco conceived a whole range of pongs for release at Christmas 1977.

This pong is identical to the original Telstar but with a big deluxe wooden frame.

There's a 3 positions switch that controls difficulty (beginner : slow ball, big paddles / advanced : fast ball, big paddles / expert : fast ball, small paddles). If this is common to the first Telstars, this is quite different from most of the other pong systems which offer individual settings.

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT (1979)</strong></font><br><blockquote>New version with Shugart 360 KB formatted capacity floppy drives. Advert said:<br><br> <font color="#666666">North Star has quadrupled the disk capacity of the Horizon computer but prices have increased a modest 15 percent. On a dollar per byte basis, that's a bargain that is hard to beat!...</font><br><br> 1979 prices for assembled versions including 32KB RAM, one parallel and two serial I/O ports:<br> 1 F.D. version: <b>$2565</b><br> 2 F.D. version: <b>$3215</b>     </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> MOTOROLA AD.</strong></font><br><blockquote>In fact, this advert didn't promote the Macintosh II computer but the 68020 microprocessor.<br> Advert said:<br><br><font color="#666666"> ...While Apple's choice of the MC 68020 was a smart move, there's no licence on genius: the 68020 is the microprocessor of choice in advanced business system design by such industry leaders as Altos, Alpha Micro, Casio, C.Itoh, Fujitsu, Honneywell Bull, NEC, NCR, Olivetti, Plexus, Ricoh, Sanyo, Sharp, TI, Toshiba and Unisys...</font></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ARABIC MODEL</strong></font><br><blockquote>In late 1988, bilingual (arab / french) versions of the TO-7/70 were sold for peanuts. These models could display latin and arabic characters. The keyboard was also bilingual, as well as the Basic !</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> FIRST VICTOR ADVERT (1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote>with the original Victor design.<br><br> Advert said: <br><br> <font color="#666666">The Victor 9000. It's a desktop system computer designed to be a "cut above" the rest...</font> </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> STRONG WOOMAN(1982)</strong></font><br><blockquote>Don't beleive this advert!<br> Please, look carefully at the quite horizontal shoulders of the woman who carries the Osborne (about 12 Kg). Either she is a champion of wrestling, or the Osborne case is empty. <br><br> </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> US ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to Dave Dunfield and his <a href="http://parse.com/~ddunfield/museum/index.htm" target="_blank">website</a> for this advert</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> DEMO TAPE INLAY #1</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://www.primo.homeserver.hu/" target="_blank">PRIMO home-page</a> for this picture.</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>advert said:<br><br> No waiting for software<font color="#666666"> ...This exciting micro has fired the imagination of programmers who are busy developping new software to take full advantage of its performance capabilities...</font><br><br> No wait state<font color="#666666"> ...One advantage is the total elimination of memory access wait states so that interaction between the processor, RAM and disk drive is speeded up...</font><br><br> A free p-System for those who don't wait <font color="#666666"> ...A free p-System operating system and PASCAL, FORTRAN 77 and BASIC compilers which alone lists for $1475, we're now including free with the Sage II...</font>  </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> SECOND 6502</strong></font><br><blockquote>The Second Processor option features, in a separate case, a 3 MHz 6502 processor and 64 KB of RAM. It was connected to the BBC system through the Tube channel. The BBC RAM was then used as video RAM, so the full memory area of the Second Processor was available for user programs.<br> Two ROMs was also delivered. The first one holded a new BASIC version called HI-BASIC that made full use of the new memory configuration. The other updated disc or Econet filling system.<p class="petitgris">Courtesy of <b>8BS.com</b></p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> 1977 ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>The advert said : <br><br> Waiting for you, all the incredible performance and power of the IMSAI 8080. And at a price you would normally pay for a home music system : $699 in kit, $931 assembled...<br><br> <b>WORLS OF USES : </b>The IMSAI 8080 is a superbly engineered, putting litterally hundreds of applications and uses at your fingertype...<br><br> <b>GROWS WITH YOU : </b>The IMSAI 8080 is designed for many years of pleasure. With its open-chassis engineering, you can expand your system by adding peripherals and interfaces. The 22 slots and 28 amperes power supply mean that you can plug-in todays's plus tomorrow's modules. Right now, you can add a module for displaying color graphics and characters on TV, a ready-to-use keyboard, a cassette tape recorder, small and large printers...<br><br> <b>EASY TO PROGRAM : </b>With our BASIC language, you can operate the IMSAI 8080 quickly and easily. Thechnically knowledgeable ? Use our assembly language to develop sophisticated and unique software.</blockquote>
